intro: Allagoptera leucocalyx, commonly known as the white-flowered allagoptera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a small, capsule that splits open to release seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas.
